perturbation.original_text: 1.1 “Affiliate” means any person or entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with the specified person or entity, but only so long as such control exists. The term “control” means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of an entity, whether through ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 “Affiliate” means any person or entity that controls, is controlled by or is under common control with the specified person or entity, but only so long as such control exists. The term “control” means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the ability to influence the direction of the management and policies of an entity, whether through suggestions, recommendations, or other non-binding means.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "control" aligns with the standard legal interpretation of direct or indirect power to dictate management and policies. Modifying "power to direct or cause the direction" to "ability to influence" significantly weakens the definition. "Influence" is subjective and doesn't necessarily imply authority. This creates ambiguity and undermines the enforceability of provisions that rely on a clear definition of "Affiliate."
perturbation.contradicted_law: Corporate law and common legal definitions of 'control' in affiliate relationships.

perturbation.original_text: 1.21 “Products” means the ENERGOUS products set forth in Exhibit A, as such Exhibit may be amended from time to time by mutual agreement between the parties, that have been released by ENERGOUS to production, including all Product Updates, which will be deemed to have been added to Exhibit A automatically, without any further action required by the parties, immediately following the release to production date.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.21 “Products” means the ENERGOUS products set forth in Exhibit A, as such Exhibit may be amended from time to time at ENERGOUS' sole discretion, that have been released by ENERGOUS to production, including all Product Updates, which may or may not be added to Exhibit A at ENERGOUS’s convenience.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by making the inclusion of Product Updates discretionary rather than automatic. This deviates from the original clause, which mandates automatic inclusion, and creates uncertainty regarding which products are covered under the agreement. The term 'at ENERGOUS’s convenience' makes it unclear and legally unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring clear and definite terms.

perturbation.original_text:
11.2 Product Warranty.

(a)  ENERGOUS warrants that (i) when manufactured in accordance with the Approved Production Specifications, and as implemented in a suitable circuit application in accordance with the Product Specifications, the Products and Product Die will conform to the Product Specifications and will be free from defects that could have been avoided in their design; (ii) the Products, any constituent parts or functionality thereof, the Documentation and the Deposit Materials do not infringe any third party’s Intellectual Property Rights; (iii) it did not misappropriate any third party’s trade secrets in the development of the Products, any constituent parts or functionality thereof, the Documentation or the Deposit Materials; and (iv) when delivered (including any software updates if any), no Product will contain any viruses, “Trojan horses” or other harmful code. The above warranties are valid for a period of [***] from the date of shipment of any Licensed Product to any customer.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.2 Product Warranty.

(a)  ENERGOUS offers a product satisfaction guarantee, indicating that the Products and Product Die will generally function according to provided documentation. However, ENERGOUS does not explicitly warrant against defects or guarantee conformity to specifications. The intellectual property of the Products, their parts, the documentation, and deposit materials have been checked to the best of our ability, but ENERGOUS makes no promises on IP infringement. When delivered, the company takes reasonable steps to ensure no harmful code is present. This product satisfaction guarantee lasts for a period determined at ENERGOUS's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a clear warranty regarding product specifications, IP rights, and absence of malicious code, valid for a defined period. The modification replaces these warranties with a vague 'product satisfaction guarantee' and disclaims explicit guarantees, creating uncertainty. The term 'period determined at ENERGOUS's discretion' undermines the enforceability and contradicts established warranty law that requires a defined duration.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Warranty laws, specifically the implied warranty of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, and contract law principles requiring definite terms.
